ticketpy package¶

ticketpy.client module¶

API client classes

class ticketpy.client.ApiClient(api_key, version='v2', response_type='json')¶

Bases: object

ApiClient for the Ticketmaster Discovery API

Request URLs end up looking like: http://app.ticketmaster.com/discovery/v2/events.json?apikey={api_key}

API key

URL for /attractions/

class ticketpy.client.PageIterator(api_client, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Iterates through API response pages

all()¶

Returns a flat list of all results. Queries all possible pages.

Use limit() to restrict the number of calls being made.

Returns:Flat list of results
api_client = None¶

Parent API client

current_page = None¶

Current page number

end_page = None¶

Final page number

limit(max_pages=10)¶

Limit the number of page requests. Default: 5

With a default page size of 20, limit(max_pages=5 would return a maximum of 200 items (fewer, if there are fewer results).

Use this to contain the number of API calls being made, as the API restricts users to a maximum of 5,000 per day. Very broad searches can return a large number of pages.

To contrast, all() will automatically request every page available.

Parameters:max_pages – Maximum number of pages to request. Default: 10. Set to None (or use all()) to return all pages.
Returns:Flat list of results from pages
next()¶
page = None¶

Current page

start_page = None¶

Initial page number

class ticketpy.query.ClassificationQuery(api_client)¶

Bases: ticketpy.query.BaseQuery

Classification search/query class

by_id(entity_id)¶

Returns a Segment, Genre or SubGenre matching the given entity ID. If no matching IDs are found, returns None

Parameters:entity_id – Segment, genre or subgenre ID
Returns:Segment, Genre or SubGenre, depending which matches the ID.
find(sort=None, keyword=None, classification_id=None, source=None, include_test=None, page=None, size=None, locale=None, **kwargs)¶

Search classifications

  • classification_id –
  • source –
  • include_test – Include test classifications ([‘yes’, ‘no’, ‘only’])
  • page –
  • size –
  • locale – API default: en
  • kwargs –
Returns:
query_subclass_id(entity_id)¶

BaseQuery.by_id() renamed for this class, as classifications don’t have IDs, but the same query will return IDs for segments, genres and subgenres (whichever matches). ClassificationQuery.by_id() will return the correct object, rather than the entire parent structure of any given ID

class ticketpy.query.EventQuery(api_client)¶

Bases: ticketpy.query.BaseQuery

Abstraction to search API for events

by_location(latitude, longitude, radius='10', unit='miles', sort='relevance, desc', **kwargs)¶

Searches events within a radius of a latitude/longitude coordinate.

Parameters:
  • latitude – Latitude of radius center
  • longitude – Longitude of radius center
  • radius – Radius to search outside given latitude/longitude
  • unit – Unit of radius (‘miles’ or ‘km’),
  • sort – Sort method. (Default: relevance, desc). If changed, you may get wonky results (date, asc returns far-away events)
Returns:

List of events within that area
find(sort='date, asc', latlong=None, radius=None, unit=None, start_date_time=None, end_date_time=None, onsale_start_date_time=None, onsale_end_date_time=None, country_code=None, state_code=None, venue_id=None, attraction_id=None, segment_id=None, segment_name=None, classification_name=None, classification_id=None, market_id=None, promoter_id=None, dma_id=None, include_tba=None, include_tbd=None, client_visibility=None, keyword=None, event_id=None, source=None, include_test=None, page=None, size=None, locale=None, **kwargs)¶

Search for events matching given criteria.

Parameters:
  • sort – Sorting order of search result (default: ‘relevance, desc’)
  • latlong – Latitude/longitude filter
  • radius – Radius of area to search
  • unit – Unit of radius, ‘miles’ or ‘km’ (default: miles)
  • start_date_time – Filter by start date/time. Timestamp format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
  • end_date_time – Filter by end date/time. Timestamp format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
  • onsale_start_date_time –
  • onsale_end_date_time –
  • country_code –
  • state_code – State code (ex: ‘GA’ not ‘Georgia’)
  • venue_id – Find events for provided venue ID
  • attraction_id –
  • segment_id –
  • segment_name –
  • classification_name – Filter events by a list of classification name(s) (genre/subgenre/type/subtype/segment)
  • classification_id –
  • market_id –
  • promoter_id –
  • dma_id –
  • include_tba – True to include events with a to-be-announced date ([‘yes’, ‘no’, ‘only’])
  • include_tbd – True to include an event with a date to be defined ([‘yes’, ‘no’, ‘only’])
  • client_visibility –
  • keyword –
  • event_id – Event ID to search
  • source – Filter entities by source name: [‘ticketmaster’, ‘universe’, ‘frontgate’, ‘tmr’]
  • include_test – ‘yes’ to include test entities in the response. False or ‘no’ to exclude. ‘only’ to return ONLY test entities. ([‘yes’, ‘no’, ‘only’])
  • page – Page number to get (default: 0)
  • size – Size of page (default: 20)
  • locale – Locale (default: ‘en’)
Returns:
class ticketpy.query.VenueQuery(api_client)¶

Bases: ticketpy.query.BaseQuery

Queries for venues

by_name(venue_name, state_code=None, **kwargs)¶

Search for a venue by name.

Parameters:
  • venue_name – Venue name to search
  • state_code – Two-letter state code to narrow results (ex ‘GA’) (default: None)
Returns:

List of venues found matching search criteria
find(keyword=None, venue_id=None, sort=None, state_code=None, country_code=None, source=None, include_test=None, page=None, size=None, locale=None, **kwargs)¶

Search for venues matching provided parameters

Parameters:
  • keyword – Keyword to search on (such as part of the venue name)
  • venue_id – Venue ID
  • sort – Sort method for response (API default: ‘name,asc’)
  • state_code – Filter by state code (ex: ‘GA’ not ‘Georgia’)
  • country_code – Filter by country code
  • source – Filter entities by source ([‘ticketmaster’, ‘universe’, ‘frontgate’, ‘tmr’])
  • include_test – [‘yes’, ‘no’, ‘only’], whether to include entities flagged as test in the response (default: ‘no’)
  • page – Page number (default: 0)
  • size – Page size of the response (default: 20)
  • locale – Locale (default: ‘en’)
Returns:

Venues found matching criteria
Return type:

ticketpy.PageIterator

class ticketpy.model.Event(event_id=None, name=None, start_date=None, start_time=None, status=None, price_ranges=None, venues=None, utc_datetime=None, classifications=None, links=None)¶

Bases: object

Ticketmaster event.

The JSON returned from the Discovery API (at least, as far as what’s being used here) looks like:

{
    "name": "Event name",
    "dates": {
        "start": {
            "localDate": "2019-04-01",
            "localTime": "2019-04-01T23:00:00Z"
        },
        "status": {
            "code": "onsale"
        }
    },
    "classifications": [
        {
            "genre": {
                "name": "Rock"
            }
        },
        {
            "genre": {
                "name": "Funk"
            }
        }
    ],
    "priceRanges": [
        {
            "min": 10,
            "max": 25
        }
    ],
    "_embedded": {
        "venues": [
            {
                "name": "The Tabernacle"
            }
        ]
    }
}
classifications = None¶

List of classifications

static from_json(json_event)¶

Creates an Event from API’s JSON response

Parameters:json_event – Deserialized JSON object from API response
Returns:ticketpy.Event
local_start_date = None¶

Local start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

local_start_time = None¶

Local start time (HH:MM:SS)

price_ranges = None¶

Price ranges found for tickets

status = None¶

Sale status (such as Cancelled, Offsale...)

utc_datetime¶

Start date/time in UTC (Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

Returns:Start date/time in UTC
Return type:datetime
venues = None¶

List of ticketpy.Venue objects associated with this event

class ticketpy.model.Venue(name=None, address=None, city=None, state_code=None, postal_code=None, latitude=None, longitude=None, markets=None, url=None, box_office_info=None, dmas=None, general_info=None, venue_id=None, social=None, timezone=None, images=None, parking_detail=None, accessible_seating_detail=None, links=None)¶

Bases: object

A Ticketmaster venue

The JSON returned from the Discovery API looks something like this (edited for brevity):

{
    "id": "KovZpaFEZe",
    "name": "The Tabernacle",
    "url": "http://www.ticketmaster.com/venue/115031",
    "timezone": "America/New_York",
    "address": {
        "line1": "152 Luckie Street"
    },
    "city": {
        "name": "Atlanta"
    },
    "postalCode": "30303",
    "state": {
        "stateCode": "GA",
        "name": "Georgia"
    },
    "country": {
        "name": "United States Of America",
        "countryCode": "US"
    },
    "location": {
        "latitude": "33.758688",
        "longitude": "-84.391449"
    },
    "social": {
        "twitter": {
            "handle": "@TabernacleATL"
        }
    },
    "markets": [
        {
            "id": "10"
        }
    ]
}
address = None¶

Street address (first line)

city = None¶

City name

static from_json(json_venue)¶

Create a Venue object from the API response’s JSON data

Parameters:json_venue – Deserialized JSON from API response
Returns:ticketpy.Venue
general_info = None¶

General info on the venue

id = None¶

Venue ID (use to look up events)

images = None¶

Ticketmaster venue image links

latitude = None¶

Latitude

location¶

All location-based data (full address, lat/lon, timezone

longitude = None¶

Longitude

markets = None¶

List of market IDs

name = None¶

Venue’s name

parking_detail = None¶

Parking details

postal_code = None¶

Zip/postal code

social = None¶

Social media links (Twitter, etc)

state_code = None¶

State code (ex: ‘GA’ not ‘Georgia’)

timezone = None¶

Timezone venue’s located in

url = None¶

Ticketmaster internal venue URL
